experience.description: RIT needed a centralized location to allow faculty to better find suitable candidates for open Teaching Assistant positions and for current TAs to better access course related responsibilities. Developed a full-stack Next.js-based Course Assistant portal as part of a 4-person team.
responsibilities: Designed a user workflow engine, translating requirements into technical specifications and working solutions
Implemented backend calls and constructed main frontend portal and common usability standards
Resulting application met stakeholder requirements with plans for release to entire department

experience.description: Brought on to reduce manual processing overhead and improve efficiency across the IT department where they experienced high volumes of repetitive data transformations. Worked with a team of 4 Engineers to Implement automation using XSLT and XPATH to streamline business processes.
responsibilities: Conducted process review, technical documentation, application administration, and testing
Utilized automation orchestration tools to implement system designs, streamlining tasks such as server decommissioning
Enhanced overall team velocity metric resulting in 20% reduction of ticket turn around time
Contacted alumni of the school to raise money, raising on average $61 per hour for the institution
Maintained a positive and professional tone to build rapport, strengthen alumni relations, and promote continued engagement with the institution.
Accurately recorded call outcomes and donor information in CRM software, ensuring data integrity and compliance with privacy standards.
Led ice breaker activities for 25 new students
Served as a guide and role model for new students
Worked in a team of 4 interns to manage request management software
Used Python to develop a machine learning algorithm to predict wait times for user-made requests
Leveraged agile development methods to ensure project completion by the given date
